contentList.content: This ability requires Monk level 5
This ability requires Monk level 9

Gain the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dash">Dash</LSTag> action as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> this turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

Gain the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Disengage">Disengage</LSTag> action as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> this turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.
Gain the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dodge">Dodge</LSTag> action as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> this turn.
Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

Reduce the damage from a ranged weapon attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you can use a Ki Point to Deflect the Missile.
Throw Back Missiles
Throw Back Missiles (Disadvantage)

Use your reflexes to catch a projectile from a ranged weapon attack and shoot it back at your attacker to a max distance of [1].
You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack.

Use your reflexes to catch a projectile from a ranged weapon attack and shoot it back at your attacker to a max distance of [1].
You will get disadvantage because your target is above [2].
You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack.
Open Hand Techniques

You can manipulate your enemy's ki when you harness your own. Whenever you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FlurryOfBlows_FirstAttack">Flurry of Blows</LSTag>, you can impose one of the following effects on that target: prone, pushed, no reaction.
Open Hand Technique: Topple
Target must succeed on a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be knocked <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Open Hand Technique: Push
Target must succeed on a Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be pushed [1] away.
Pushed away
Open Hand Technique: Stagger
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="OPEN_HAND_NO_REACTIONS">Stagger</LSTag> the target, making it unable to take reactions.
When you fall, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.
Affected entity knows how to break its fall. It takes reduced falling damage.

You can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.
You gain the ability to heal yourself. As an action, you can regain hit points equal to three times your monk level. You must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.
Stillness of Mind (Passive)
If you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag>, you automatically cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_StillnessOfMind">Stillness of Mind</LSTag> to remove the condition.
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag> doesn't slow you down while you are not wearing armour or using a shield.
Ki Resonation (Passive)
Ki Resonation

When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend [1] ki points to set up lethal vibrations. The vibrations are harmless unless you use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_KiResonation_Blast">Lesser Quivering Palm</LSTag> to end them.
Set up lethal vibrations. The vibrations are harmless unless you use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_KiResonation_Blast">Lesser Quivering Palm</LSTag> to end them.
Lesser Quivering Palm
Detonate the ki of a creature <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KI_RESONATION">Resonating</LSTag> with you. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, it takes [1] necrotic damage.
The ki within the affected entity is resonating with a monk's. The monk can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_KiResonation_Blast">Lesser Quivering Palm</LSTag> to make it explode.

Cause tendrils of flame to stretch out from your fists and feet. Your reach with your unarmed strikes increases by 3m and deals fire damage for the rest of the turn. If you spend 1 ki point when the attack hits, it also deals an extra 1d10 fire damage.
Deals an extra 1d10 fire damage.
